description: Assess and enhance skills across all platforms (Agent, Claude, Cursor) for conflicts, uniqueness, formatting, and platform-specific features

userStories.title: Explore Agentic-Skills structure and document platforms
userStories.description: As an analyst, I want to understand the directory structure of Agentic-Skills to identify all platforms and their skill sets.
acceptanceCriteria: List all platform directories (.agent, .claude, .cursor, root skills/)
Identify all skill categories in each platform
Document the total count of skills per platform
userStories.notes: Explored all platform directories: .agent (69 skills), .claude (68 skills), .cursor (67 skills). Massive overlap - 67-68 skills duplicated across platforms. Each platform also has agents, commands/rules, scripts, and workflows directories.

userStories.title: Read platform documentation for skills format
userStories.description: As an analyst, I want to read the official documentation for each platform to understand their skill format guidelines.
acceptanceCriteria: Research Agent platform skill format (.agent directory)
Research Claude Code skill format (.claude directory)
Research Cursor IDE skill format (.cursor directory)
Document format requirements for each platform
userStories.notes: Researched all three platforms. Key findings: .agent uses workflows/ with YAML frontmatter (trigger, description), .claude uses commands/ with $ARGUMENTS, .cursor uses commands/ similar to .claude but with different agent integration. Skills format is consistent across all (SKILL.md with name/description frontmatter). Agents in .agent/.cursor have YAML frontmatter (name, description, model, color) while .claude uses plain markdown with Referenced skills section.

userStories.title: Check skills for conflicts and uniqueness
userStories.description: As an analyst, I want to check if skills conflict with each other or have duplicates across platforms.
userStories.notes: Analyzed all three platforms. Findings: (1) 67 common skills across all platforms but ALL have different content - major conflict; (2) 16 skills differ between .claude and .cursor (architecture, create-rule, create-subagent, geo-fundamentals, intelligent-routing, lint-and-validate, mcp-builder, mobile-design, parallel-agents, senior-agile-pm-budget-analyst, senior-software-developer, sequential-thinking, update-cursor-settings, using-superpowers, writing-prompts, writing-skills); (3) doc.md incorrectly placed in .agent/skills (not a skill, it's documentation); (4) gemini skill duplicated in .agent and .claude; (5) 18 common agents across platforms with potential content differences. Recommendations: Consolidate to single source of truth per skill, remove doc.md, deduplicate gemini.

userStories.title: Validate skills against platform guidelines
userStories.description: As an analyst, I want to validate each skill against its platform's formatting guidelines.
acceptanceCriteria: Check each skill has required files (SKILL.md)
Check for common errors or missing fields
userStories.notes: Validated all skills across platforms. Findings: (1) .claude has 68 skills, .agent has 68 skills, .cursor has 67 skills - all with SKILL.md files; (2) All skills have proper YAML frontmatter with name and description; (3) doc.md incorrectly placed in .agent/skills/ - documentation file, not a skill; (4) All skills follow kebab-case naming convention; (5) Template files (TEMPLATE.md) found in app-builder templates across all platforms - these follow same frontmatter format

userStories.title: Analyze workflows and command flows
userStories.description: As an analyst, I want to understand how commands/workflows connect to agents and skills.
acceptanceCriteria: Identify any issues in the flow
userStories.notes: Analyzed workflows and command flows. Flow: User command → Command file (with routing) → Agent (orchestrator) → Skills. Found: (1) Platform isolation is strictly enforced - no cross-platform links allowed; (2) Commands in .claude/commands/ and .cursor/commands/ are nearly identical; (3) .agent/workflows/ uses YAML frontmatter format; (4) All commands delegate to orchestrator agent with mode parameter; (5) Validations pass - 67-68 skills, no dangling references, all links valid; (6) Key issue: Skills referenced in agents have different content across platforms (from AS-003).

userStories.title: Research platform-specific features for enhancement
userStories.description: As an enhancer, I want to research each platform's capabilities for subagents, parallel execution, and memory.
acceptanceCriteria: Research Agent platform features (subagents, parallel, memory)
Research Claude Code specific features (MCP, tools)
userStories.notes: Researched all three platforms. Key findings: (1) Agent Platform (.agent): Uses workflows/ with YAML frontmatter, 68 skills, 15+ agents, no persistent memory file, Native Agent Tool for orchestration. (2) Claude Code (.claude): Commands with $ARGUMENTS, 68 skills, 19 agents, Persistent Memory via MEMORY.md (project-scoped), Built-in agents (Explore/Plan/General-purpose), MCP support via mcp-builder skill. (3) Cursor IDE (.cursor): Commands with $ARGUMENTS, 67 skills, 19 agents including unique 'verifier' agent, no memory file, Built-in agents (Explore/Plan/General-purpose), rules/ directory. (4) All platforms share: 16 command modes, domain-based agent routing, file ownership rules, pre-flight checks. (5) Enhancement opportunities: Add persistent memory to .agent and .cursor, add verifier to .agent/.claude, align skills across platforms.

userStories.title: Enhance skills with platform-specific features
userStories.description: As an enhancer, I want to update skills to leverage each platform's unique features.
acceptanceCriteria: Update at least 3 skills with subagent patterns

userStories.title: Create comprehensive assessment report
userStories.description: As a reporter, I want to create a final report with all findings and recommendations.
acceptanceCriteria: Summarize all findings from AS-001 to AS-007
List all conflicts and duplicates found
